特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: Classes will be interactive and group-work based, with some language and skills guidance from the teacher. Learners are expected to participate actively in all tasks to gain the maximum benefit to their spoken English skills. There will be a range of spoken tasks, including group discussions, presentations, supported by reading & listening tasks. Materials will include a selection from the textbook as well as additional materials distributed in class and on LUNA.

トピック.授業計画1:
This course will use a range of in-class tasks to help develop learners’ spoken fluency as well as ability to deliver more effective presentations & use a range of skills to interact more successfully in group discussions/conversations. Indicative content includes (but is not limited to):

Presentation planning and practice
Short presentations of around 5 minutes (both assessed and unassessed)
Studying different aspects of presentation skills through video and in-class materials.
Short discussion tasks of around 5 minutes (both assessed and unassessed)
Learn and use selected strategies for interacting in discussions.
Reading, reflecting on and discussing text-book readings
Listening to, reflecting on and discussing text-book audio
Vocabulary building tasks

Full schedule details of class content, homework and assessments will be given on LUNA throughout the semester.

NOTE The above content will be modified and adapted to suit the learners’ abilities.
トピック.授業外学習2:
Learners will be expected to completed homework tasks from the course text to review and prepare for classes each week. A minimum of 1 hour per week should be spent on homework tasks. Homework tasks include (but are not limited to):

Pre-class reading/listening on the unit topic
Presentation and discussion preparation
Presentation and discussion written review
Vocabulary practice
Free-writing
